segment.source: Choose how a default copyright date is selected for an article. This default can be overridden on a case-by-case basis. If you "publish as you go", don't use the issue's publication date.
segment.target: Choose how a default copyright date is selected for an article. This default can be overridden on a case-by-case basis. If you "publish as you go", don't use the issue's publication date.

segment.source: OJS will not be used to publish the journal's contents online.
segment.target: OJS will not be used to publish the journal's contents online.

segment.source: The journal will provide open access to its contents.
segment.target: The journal will provide open access to its contents.

segment.source: The journal will require subscriptions to access some or all of its contents.
segment.target: The journal will require subscriptions to access some or all of its contents.

segment.source: The publishing details have been updated.
segment.target: The publishing details have been updated.

segment.source: Are you sure you want to reset all email templates in this journal? You will lose any customizations you have made.
segment.target: Are you sure you want to reset all email templates in this journal? You will lose any customizations you have made.

segment.source: Note: The Files Browser is an advanced feature that allows the files and directories associated with a journal to be viewed and manipulated directly.
segment.target: Note: The Files Browser is an advanced feature that allows the files and directories associated with a journal to be viewed and manipulated directly.

segment.source: This will replace any locale-specific journal settings you had for this locale
segment.target: This will replace any locale-specific journal settings you had for this locale

segment.source:
OJS can be made available to users in any of several supported languages. As well, OJS can operate as a multilingual system, providing users with an ability to toggle between languages on each page, and allowing certain data to be entered in several additional languages.

If a language supported by OJS is not listed below, ask your site administrator to install the language from the site administration interface. For instructions on adding support for new languages, please consult the OJS documentation.
segment.target:
OJS can be made available to users in any of several supported languages. As well, OJS can operate as a multilingual system, providing users with an ability to toggle between languages on each page, and allowing certain data to be entered in several additional languages.

If a language supported by OJS is not listed below, ask your site administrator to install the language from the site administration interface. For instructions on adding support for new languages, please consult the OJS documentation.

segment.source: Sorry, no additional languages are available. Contact your site administrator if you wish to use additional languages with this journal.
segment.target: Sorry, no additional languages are available. Contact your site administrator if you wish to use additional languages with this journal.

segment.source: This will be the default language for the journal site.
segment.target: This will be the default language for the journal site.

segment.source: Enter fee amounts below in order to enable author processing charges.
segment.target: Enter fee amounts below in order to enable author processing charges.

segment.source: OJS does not perform any currency conversions. If accepting payments for subscriptions, you must ensure that the subscription currency matches the one specified here.
segment.target: OJS does not perform any currency conversions. If accepting payments for subscriptions, you must ensure that the subscription currency matches the one specified here.

segment.source: All costs must be positive numeric values (decimal points are allowed)
segment.target: All costs must be positive numeric values (decimal points are allowed)

segment.source: The Association Membership will appear in About the Journal under Policies, and the donations link will appear above the search function in the right-hand frame.
segment.target: The Association Membership will appear in About the Journal under Policies, and the donations link will appear above the search function in the right-hand frame.

segment.source: This will activate payments for Subscriptions, where types, cost, duration and subscriptions are managed by the Journal (Subscription) Manager.
segment.target: This will activate payments for Subscriptions, where types, cost, duration and subscriptions are managed by the Journal (Subscription) Manager.

segment.source: Are you sure you wish to delete this subscription?
segment.target: Are you sure you wish to delete this subscription?

segment.source: The payment settings have been updated.
segment.target: The payment settings have been updated.

segment.source: Payments will be enabled for this journal. Note that users will be required to log in to make payments.
segment.target: Payments will be enabled for this journal. Note that users will be required to log in to make payments.

segment.source: Only Restrict Access to PDF version of issues and articles
segment.target: Only Restrict Access to PDF version of issues and articles

segment.source: You may configure any of the following Payment Method Plugins from this screen.
segment.target: You may configure any of the following Payment Method Plugins from this screen.

segment.source: Selected options, along with their descriptions and fees (which can be edited below), will appear in About the Journal under Policies, as well as at points where payment is required.
segment.target: Selected options, along with their descriptions and fees (which can be edited below), will appear in About the Journal under Policies, as well as at points where payment is required.

segment.source: Enroll a User from this Site in this Journal
segment.target: Enroll a User from this Site in this Journal

segment.source: Remove this user from this journal? This action will unenroll the user from all roles within this journal.
segment.target: Remove this user from this journal? This action will unenroll the user from all roles within this journal.

segment.source: Select a user (or several) to merge into another user account (e.g., when someone has two user accounts). The account(s) selected first will be deleted and any submissions, assignments, etc. will be attributed to the second account.
segment.target: Select a user (or several) to merge into another user account (e.g., when someone has two user accounts). The account(s) selected first will be deleted and any submissions, assignments, etc. will be attributed to the second account.

segment.source: Select a user to whom to attribute the previous users' authorships, editing assignments, etc.
segment.target: Select a user to whom to attribute the previous users' authorships, editing assignments, etc.

segment.source: Enrollment synchronization will enroll all users enrolled in the specified role in the specified journal into the same role in this journal. This function allows a common set of users (e.g., Reviewers) to be synchronized between journals.
segment.target: Enrollment synchronization will enroll all users enrolled in the specified role in the specified journal into the same role in this journal. This function allows a common set of users (e.g., Reviewers) to be synchronized between journals.

segment.source: There are no section editors yet. Add this role to at least one user via Management > Settings > Users & Roles first.
segment.target: There are no section editors yet. Add this role to at least one user via Management > Settings > Users & Roles first.

segment.source: Are you sure you want to permanently delete this section?
segment.target: Are you sure you want to permanently delete this section?

segment.source: Before this section can be deleted, you must move articles published within it into other sections.
segment.target: Before this section can be deleted, you must move articles published within it into other sections.

segment.source: Add a Section Editor to this section to have submissions automatically assigned to the Section Editor. (Otherwise, Section Editors can be assigned manually, after a submission comes in.) If added, a Section Editor can be automatically assigned to oversee the REVIEW (peer review) and/or the EDITING (copyediting, layout and proofreading) of submissions to this section. Section Editors are created by clicking Section Editors under Roles in Journal Management.
segment.target: Add a Section Editor to this section to have submissions automatically assigned to the Section Editor. (Otherwise, Section Editors can be assigned manually, after a submission comes in.) If added, a Section Editor can be automatically assigned to oversee the REVIEW (peer review) and/or the EDITING (copyediting, layout and proofreading) of submissions to this section. Section Editors are created by clicking Section Editors under Roles in Journal Management.

segment.source: Items can only be submitted by Editors and Section Editors.
segment.target: Items can only be submitted by Editors and Section Editors.

segment.source: An abbreviated title is required for the section
segment.target: An abbreviated title is required for the section

segment.source: Please ensure that at least one checkbox is checked for each Section Editor assignment.
segment.target: Please ensure that at least one checkbox is checked for each Section Editor assignment.

segment.source: Please ensure that you have chosen a valid review form.
segment.target: Please ensure that you have chosen a valid review form.

segment.source: A title is required for the section.
segment.target: A title is required for the section.

segment.target: The prepared emails that are sent by the system on behalf of the journal will have the following signature added to the end.

segment.source: For Authors to Index Their Work
segment.target: For Authors to Index Their Work

segment.source: OJS adheres to the Open Archives Initiative Protocol for Metadata Harvesting, which is the emerging standard for providing well-indexed access to electronic research resources on a global scale. The authors will use a similar template to provide metadata for their submission. The Journal Manager should select the categories for indexing and present authors with relevant examples to assist them in indexing their work.
segment.target: OJS adheres to the Open Archives Initiative Protocol for Metadata Harvesting, which is the emerging standard for providing well-indexed access to electronic research resources on a global scale. The authors will use a similar template to provide metadata for their submission. The Journal Manager should select the categories for indexing and present authors with relevant examples to assist them in indexing their work.

segment.target: The primary contact name is required.

segment.source: The number of reviewers per submission is required.
segment.target: The number of reviewers per submission is required.

segment.target: For journals that offer immediate or delayed open access, include a Creative Commons license with all published work at the appropriate time.

segment.target: Limit the number of items (for example, submissions, users, or editing assignments) to show in a list before showing subsequent items in another page.

segment.source: Include any information about your journal which may be of interest to readers, authors or reviewers. This could include your open access policy, the focus and scope of the journal, copyright notice, sponsorship disclosure, history of the journal, a privacy statement, and inclusion in any LOCKSS or CLOCKSS archival system.
segment.target: Include any information about your journal which may be of interest to readers, authors or reviewers. This could include your open access policy, the focus and scope of the journal, copyright notice, sponsorship disclosure, history of the journal, a privacy statement, and inclusion in any LOCKSS or CLOCKSS archival system.

segment.source: By default, the homepage consists of navigation links. Additional homepage content can be appended by using one or all of the following options, which will appear in the order shown. Note that the current issue is always accessible through the Current link in the navigation bar.
segment.target: By default, the homepage consists of navigation links. Additional homepage content can be appended by using one or all of the following options, which will appear in the order shown. Note that the current issue is always accessible through the Current link in the navigation bar.

segment.source: A graphic version of the journal's title and logo (as a .gif, .jpg, or .png file) can be uploaded for the homepage, which will replace the text version that otherwise appears.
segment.target: A graphic version of the journal's title and logo (as a .gif, .jpg, or .png file) can be uploaded for the homepage, which will replace the text version that otherwise appears.

segment.source: Choose a journal theme and select layout components here. A journal stylesheet may also be uploaded, which can be used to override style data in the system-wide stylesheets and theme stylesheet (if a theme is chosen).
segment.target: Choose a journal theme and select layout components here. A journal stylesheet may also be uploaded, which can be used to override style data in the system-wide stylesheets and theme stylesheet (if a theme is chosen).

segment.source: This is the footer of your journal. To change or update the footer, paste the HTML code in the textbox below. Examples could be another navigation bar, a counter, etc. This footer will appear on every page.
segment.target: This is the footer of your journal. To change or update the footer, paste the HTML code in the textbox below. Examples could be another navigation bar, a counter, etc. This footer will appear on every page.

segment.source: Your journal setup has been updated.
segment.target: Your journal setup has been updated.

segment.source: Invalid journal stylesheet format. Accepted format is .css.
segment.target: Invalid journal stylesheet format. Accepted format is .css.

segment.target: A small logo or representation of the journal that can be used in lists of journals.

segment.target: Provide a short description of your journal and identify editors, managing directors and other members of your editorial team.

segment.target: The list settings for this journal have been updated.

segment.target: The PKP Preservation Network (PN) provides free preservation services for any OJS journal that meets a few basic criteria.

segment.target: View the <button>plugin settings</button> to accept the terms of use for the PKP PN.

segment.source: The PKP Preservation Network (PN) provides free preservation services for any OJS journal that meets a few basic criteria. The PKP PN plugin for OJS 3 is currently in development and will be available in the plugin gallery soon.
segment.target: The PKP Preservation Network (PN) provides free preservation services for any OJS journal that meets a few basic criteria. The PKP PN plugin for OJS 3 is currently in development and will be available in the plugin gallery soon.

segment.target: Enable LOCKSS to store and distribute journal content at participating libraries via a LOCKSS Publisher Manifest page.

segment.target: A LOCKSS license will appear in About the Journal under Archiving: LOCKSS License

segment.target: Homepage header, content, journal header, footer, navigation bar, and style sheet.

segment.target: Access and security, scheduling, announcements, copyediting, layout, and proofreading.

segment.target: URL is an absolute URL (e.g., "http://www.example.com") rather than a path relative to the site (e.g., "/manager/setup")

segment.source: The Proofreading Instructions will be made available to Proofreaders, Authors, Layout Editors, and Section Editors in the Submission Editing stage. Below is a default set of instructions in HTML, which can be edited or replaced by the Journal Manager at any point (in HTML or plain text).
segment.target: The Proofreading Instructions will be made available to Proofreaders, Authors, Layout Editors, and Section Editors in the Submission Editing stage. segment.source: Journal items can be published collectively, as part of an issue with its own Table of Contents. Alternatively, individual items can be published as soon as they are ready, by adding them to the "current" volume's Table of Contents. Provide readers, in About the Journal, with a statement about the system this journal will use and its expected frequency of publication.
segment.target: Journal items can be published collectively, as part of an issue with its own Table of Contents. Alternatively, individual items can be published as soon as they are ready, by adding them to the "current" volume's Table of Contents. Provide readers, in About the Journal, with a statement about the system this journal will use and its expected frequency of publication.

segment.source: Your journal is configured to record more than one usage metric. Usage statistics will be displayed in several contexts. There are cases where a single usage statistic must be used, e.g. to display an ordered list of most-used articles or to rank search results. Please select one of the configured metrics as a default.
segment.target: Your journal is configured to record more than one usage metric. Usage statistics will be displayed in several contexts. There are cases where a single usage statistic must be used, e.g. to display an ordered list of most-used articles or to rank search results. Please select one of the configured metrics as a default.

segment.source: OJS calculates the following statistics for each journal. The "days to review" is calculated from date of submission (or designation of Review Version) to the initial Editor Decision, while the "days to publish" is measured for accepted submissions from its original uploading to its publication.
segment.target: OJS calculates the following statistics for each journal. The "days to review" is calculated from date of submission (or designation of Review Version) to the initial Editor Decision, while the "days to publish" is measured for accepted submissions from its original uploading to its publication.

segment.source: Check items to be made available to readers in About the Journal.
segment.target: Check items to be made available to readers in About the Journal.

segment.source: Note: Percentages for peer reviewed submissions may not add up to 100%, as items resubmitted are either accepted, declined, or still in process.

segment.target: Article abstract page views and downloads

segment.source: Narrow results by context (issues and/or article).
segment.target: Narrow results by context (issues and/or article).

segment.target: Narrow results by object type (journal, issue, article, file types) and/or by one or more object id(s).

segment.source: Upon subscription expiry, readers may be denied access to all subscription content or may continue to retain access to subscription content published prior to the subscription expiry date.
segment.target: Upon subscription expiry, readers may be denied access to all subscription content or may continue to retain access to subscription content published prior to the subscription expiry date.

segment.source: Readers are denied access to all subscription content upon subscription expiry.
segment.target: Readers are denied access to all subscription content upon subscription expiry.

segment.source: Readers are denied access to recently published subscription content, but retain access to subscription content published prior to the subscription expiry date.
segment.target: Readers are denied access to recently published subscription content, but retain access to subscription content published prior to the subscription expiry date.

segment.source: Notify subscribers by email after subscription expiry
segment.target: Notify subscribers by email after subscription expiry

segment.source: Notify subscribers by email before subscription expiry.

segment.source: Notify subscribers by email before subscription expiry.
segment.target: Notify subscribers by email before subscription expiry.

segment.source: Automated email reminders (available for editing by Journal Managers in OJS's Emails) can be sent to subscribers both before and after a subscription has expired.
segment.target: Automated email reminders (available for editing by Journal Managers in OJS's Emails) can be sent to subscribers both before and after a subscription has expired.

segment.source: Note: To activate these options, the site administrator must enable the scheduled_tasks option in the OJS configuration file. Additional server configuration may be required to support this functionality (which may not be possible on all servers), as indicated in the OJS documentation.
segment.target: Note: To activate these options, the site administrator must enable the scheduled_tasks option in the OJS configuration file. Additional server configuration may be required to support this functionality (which may not be possible on all servers), as indicated in the OJS documentation.

segment.source: HTML can be used in textarea (for font size, color, etc.), with "returns" treated as <tt><br></tt>; HTML editor works with Firefox browsers.
segment.target: HTML can be used in textarea (for font size, color, etc.), with "returns" treated as <tt><br></tt>; HTML editor works with Firefox browsers.

segment.target: Please select a valid value for the number of weeks before subscription expiry.

segment.source: Registered readers will have the option of receiving the table of contents by email when an issue becomes open access.
segment.target: Registered readers will have the option of receiving the table of contents by email when an issue becomes open access.

segment.source: Note: To activate this option, the site administrator must enable the scheduled_tasks option in the OJS configuration file. Additional server configuration may be required to support this functionality (which may not be possible on all servers), as indicated in the OJS documentation.
segment.target: Note: To activate this option, the site administrator must enable the scheduled_tasks option in the OJS configuration file. Additional server configuration may be required to support this functionality (which may not be possible on all servers), as indicated in the OJS documentation.

segment.source: Automated email notifications (available for editing by Journal Managers in OJS's Emails) can be sent to the Subscription Manager upon the completion of subscription online payments.
segment.target: Automated email notifications (available for editing by Journal Managers in OJS's Emails) can be sent to the Subscription Manager upon the completion of subscription online payments.

segment.source: Notify Subscription Manager by email upon online purchase of an Individual subscription.
segment.target: Notify Subscription Manager by email upon online purchase of an Individual subscription.

segment.source: Notify Subscription Manager by email upon online purchase of an Institutional subscription (recommended).
segment.target: Notify Subscription Manager by email upon online purchase of an Institutional subscription (recommended).

segment.source: Notify Subscription Manager by email upon online renewal of an Individual subscription.
segment.target: Notify Subscription Manager by email upon online renewal of an Individual subscription.

segment.source: Notify Subscription Manager by email upon online renewal of an Institutional subscription.
segment.target: Notify Subscription Manager by email upon online renewal of an Institutional subscription.

segment.source: Note: Institutional subscriptions purchased online require approval of the provided domain and IP ranges and activation of the subscription by the Subscription Manager.
segment.target: Note: Institutional subscriptions purchased online require approval of the provided domain and IP ranges and activation of the subscription by the Subscription Manager.

segment.source: Note: To enable these options, the Journal Manager must enable the online payments module, including online payments for subscriptions, under Reader Fees.
segment.target: Note: To enable these options, the Journal Manager must enable the online payments module, including online payments for subscriptions, under Reader Fees.

segment.source: Open Access Options For Subscription Journals
segment.target: Open Access Options For Subscription Journals

segment.source: Subscription journals can provide "delayed open access" to their published content, as well as permit "author self-archiving" (both of which increase readership and citation of content).
segment.target: Subscription journals can provide "delayed open access" to their published content, as well as permit "author self-archiving" (both of which increase readership and citation of content).

segment.source: The Subscription Types and fee structure will be displayed on the subscriptions page, along with the name and contact information for the Subscription Manager. Additional information about subscriptions, such as methods of payment or support for subscribers in developing countries, can be added here.
segment.target: The Subscription Types and fee structure will be displayed on the subscriptions page, along with the name and contact information for the Subscription Manager. Additional information about subscriptions, such as methods of payment or support for subscribers in developing countries, can be added here.

segment.source: These contact details will be listed on the subscription page for customers with enquiries related to subscriptions.
segment.target: These contact details will be listed on the subscription page for customers with enquiries related to subscriptions.

segment.target: Are you sure you want to renew this subscription?

segment.target: A subscription start date is required.

segment.target: Please select a valid subscription start date.

segment.source: A subscription end date is required.
segment.target: A subscription end date is required.

segment.source: This is a non-expiring subscription type; please do not specify a start date.
segment.target: This is a non-expiring subscription type; please do not specify a start date.

segment.source: This is a non-expiring subscription type; please do not specify an end date.
segment.target: This is a non-expiring subscription type; please do not specify an end date.

segment.source: Note: All changes below are to user's system-wide profile.
segment.target: Note: All changes below are to user's system-wide profile.

segment.source: Send the user an email with their username and subscription details.
segment.target: Send the user an email with their username and subscription details.

segment.source: Enter membership information if the subscription type requires that subscribers belong to an association or organization.
segment.target: Enter membership information if the subscription type requires that subscribers belong to an association or organization.

segment.source: The selected subscription type requires membership information.
segment.target: The selected subscription type requires membership information.

segment.source:
If a domain is entered here, IP ranges are optional.
Valid values are domain names (e.g. lib.sfu.ca).
segment.target:
If a domain is entered here, IP ranges are optional.
Valid values are domain names (e.g. lib.sfu.ca).

segment.source: The selected subscription type requires a domain and/or an IP range for subscription authentication.
segment.target: The selected subscription type requires a domain and/or an IP range for subscription authentication.

segment.source:
If IP ranges are entered here, the domain is optional.
Valid values include an IP address (e.g. 142.58.103.1), IP range (e.g. 142.58.103.1 - 142.58.103.4), IP range with wildcard '*' (e.g. 142.58.*.*), and an IP range with CIDR (e.g. 142.58.100.0/24).
segment.target:
If IP ranges are entered here, the domain is optional.
Valid values include an IP address (e.g. 142.58.103.1), IP range (e.g. 142.58.103.1 - 142.58.103.4), IP range with wildcard '*' (e.g. 142.58.*.*), and an IP range with CIDR (e.g. 142.58.100.0/24).

segment.source: Please enter a valid IP range.
segment.target: Please enter a valid IP range.

segment.source: In order to send the user a notification email, the subscription contact name and email address must be specified in the journal Setup.
segment.target: In order to send the user a notification email, the subscription contact name and email address must be specified in the journal Setup.

segment.source: This user already has a subscription for this journal.
segment.target: This user already has a subscription for this journal.

segment.source: A subscription type must be created before new subscriptions can be made.
segment.target: A subscription type must be created before new subscriptions can be made.

segment.source: Subscription access privileges are automatically granted to the journal's Journal Managers, Editors, Section Editors, Layout Editors, Copyeditors, and Proofreaders.
segment.target: Subscription access privileges are automatically granted to the journal's Journal Managers, Editors, Section Editors, Layout Editors, Copyeditors, and Proofreaders.

segment.source: Warning! All subscriptions with this subscription type will also be deleted. Are you sure you want to continue and delete this subscription type?
segment.target: Warning! All subscriptions with this subscription type will also be deleted. Are you sure you want to continue and delete this subscription type?

segment.source: Enter a numeric value (e.g. 40 or 40.00) without symbol (e.g., $).
segment.target: Enter a numeric value (e.g. 40 or 40.00) without symbol (e.g., $).

segment.source: The cost must be a positive, numeric value.
segment.target: The cost must be a positive, numeric value.

segment.source: The number of months the subscription lasts (e.g. 12).
segment.target: The number of months the subscription lasts (e.g. 12).

segment.target: The duration must be a positive, numeric value.

segment.target: A subscription type format is required.

segment.target: Please select a valid subscription type format.

segment.target: Institutional (users are validated via domain or IP address)

segment.target: Subscriptions require membership information (e.g. of an association, organization, consortium, etc.)

segment.target: Do not make this subscription type publicly available or visible on the website.

segment.target: A subscription type with this name already exists.

segment.target: A subscription type name is required.

segment.target: No subscription types have been created.

segment.target: Link to a page describing the subscriptions you offer.

segment.target: Link to a page describing the visitor's current and past subscriptions.

segment.source: This link will only be displayed when a visitor is logged in.
segment.target: This link will only be displayed when a visitor is logged in.

segment.source: Choose the most appropriate categories from the set listed above. Readers will be able to browse by category from the complete journal set.
segment.target: Choose the most appropriate categories from the set listed above. Readers will be able to browse by category from the complete journal set.

segment.source: Articles within published issues of a journal are organized in Sections, typically by theme or content type (e.g. Review Articles, Research, etc).
segment.target: Articles within published issues of a journal are organized in Sections, typically by theme or content type (e.g. Review Articles, Research, etc).

segment.source: Roles are groups of users in the journal who are given access to different permission levels and associated workflows within the journal. There are five different permission levels: Journal Managers have access to everything in the journal (all content and settings); Section Editors have complete access to all assigned content; Journal Assistants have limited access to all submissions that have been explicitly assigned to them by an editor; Reviewers can see and perform the submissions they have been assigned to review; and Authors can see and interact with a limited amount of information on their own submissions. Additionally, there are five different stage assignments that roles may be given access to: Submission, Internal Review, Review, Editorial, and Production.
segment.target: Roles are groups of users in the journal who are given access to different permission levels and associated workflows within the journal. There are five different permission levels: Journal Managers have access to everything in the journal (all content and settings); Section Editors have complete access to all assigned content; Journal Assistants have limited access to all submissions that have been explicitly assigned to them by an editor; Reviewers can see and perform the submissions they have been assigned to review; and Authors can see and interact with a limited amount of information on their own submissions. Additionally, there are five different stage assignments that roles may be given access to: Submission, Internal Review, Review, Editorial, and Production.

segment.source: Base new article's copyright year on
segment.target: Base new article's copyright year on

segment.source: Article: default year will be drawn from the article's publication date, as in "publish-as-you-go".
segment.target: Article: default year will be drawn from the article's publication date, as in "publish-as-you-go".

segment.source: Issue: default year will be drawn from the issue's publication date.
segment.target: Issue: default year will be drawn from the issue's publication date.

segment.source: Are you sure you wish to reset permissions data for all articles? This action can not be undone.
segment.target: Are you sure you wish to reset permissions data for all articles? This action can not be undone.

segment.source: Remove the copyright statement and license information for every published article, reverting them to the journal's current default settings. This will permanently remove all prior copyright and licensing information attached to articles. In some cases, you may not be legally permitted to re-license work that has been published under a different license. Please take caution when using this tool and consult legal expertise if you are unsure what rights you hold over the articles published in your journal.
segment.target: Remove the copyright statement and license information for every published article, reverting them to the journal's current default settings. This will permanently remove all prior copyright and licensing information attached to articles. In some cases, you may not be legally permitted to re-license work that has been published under a different license. Please take caution when using this tool and consult legal expertise if you are unsure what rights you hold over the articles published in your journal.

segment.source: These components are used for file-naming purposes and are presented in a pull-down menu on uploading files. The genres designated ## allow the user to associate the file with either the whole submission 99Z or a particular component by number (e.g., 02).
segment.target: These components are used for file-naming purposes and are presented in a pull-down menu on uploading files. The genres designated ## allow the user to associate the file with either the whole submission 99Z or a particular component by number (e.g., 02).

segment.source: In order to use this plugin please go to the "Public Identifier" plugin category, enable and configure the DOI plugin and specify a valid DOI prefix there.
segment.target: In order to use this plugin please go to the "Public Identifier" plugin category, enable and configure the DOI plugin and specify a valid DOI prefix there.

segment.source: The plugin is not fully set up.
segment.target: The plugin is not fully set up.

segment.target: No publishing objects are selected for DOI assignment in the DOI public identifier plugin, so there is no deposit or export possibility in this plugin.

segment.target: Please note that the password will be saved as plain text, i.e. not encrypted.
